intro: Fenghwaia gardeniocarpa, commonly known as the gardenicot fruit tree, is a unique species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a distinctive, woody capsule that splits open to reveal edible seeds. Due to its rarity and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
